content.question: Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(1) = -1. Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at (1, -1) and use it to approximate f(1.1).

frqParts.text: Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(1) = -1. Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at (1, -1) and use it to approximate f(1.1).

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
